<tr>
<td style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;vertical-align: top" valign="top">
<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: separate" width="100%">
<tr>
<td class="editors_note" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding: 0px 40px 16px 40px; border-left: 2px solid #353535; border-right: 2px solid #353535; border-bottom: 2px solid #353535; border-collapse: collapse; border-radius: 0px 0px 10px 10px;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<div>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Good morning. </strong>Today is World Mental Health Day. Since one of the ways you can practice good mental health is to express gratitude, I’d like to express <em>my </em>gratitude to my friend and Morning Brew cofounder and executive chairman Alex Lieberman for working to destigmatize mental health issues.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">A lot of people look up to Alex. And they should—he started Morning Brew from nothing and was relentless in building the company to the digital media rocket ship it is today.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">What’s even more important than that, in my opinion, is how Alex uses his platform to talk about his own struggles with mental health. Alex has said he's had anxiety for his entire life, <a href="https://twitter.com/businessbarista/status/1400140794640674819?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">describing it</a> as a “pressure on my chest like a 10lb dumbbell is resting on it.” He’s also explained how he manages his anxiety, including doing therapy and establishing a strict, daily routine.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">When someone as successful as Alex—or, for that matter, Simone Biles or Naomi Osaka—open up about their struggles with mental health, it can create a much bigger space for these conversations.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">So, thank you Alex.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;font-family:flood-std, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-weight:500">—Neal Freyman</p>
</div>
</div>
</td>
</tr>

</td>
</tr>
</table>
</td>
</tr>

<td class="column" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
Icebreakers With...Andrea Hernández
</h1>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/08/icebreakers-with-snaxpert-andrea-hernandez?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" style="text-decoration:none; border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Andrea Hernández headshot" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/4d8083b28a2376ac0da6da7caf2e062b96513fe1-1500x927.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;">
<small>
<em>Andrea Hernández</em>
</small>
</p>
</a>
<div>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">We all have an opinion on sour cream and onion chips, but media entrepreneur Andrea Hernández is a snack <em>expert</em>. And she’s not being stingy with her wisdom. As a member of Andrea’s Snaxshot cult (her words, not ours) you can read her <a href="https://snaxshot.substack.com/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">newsletter</a> that dives into snack aisle trends, chat about alt-meat brands in her Discord channel, or just <a href="https://twitter.com/iiiitsandrea?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tag</a> her in your latest granola bar haul.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">We sat down for a chaotic chat with Andrea.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What are you obsessed with in the snack world right now?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><a href="https://ruby.fun/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ruby</a>, the hibiscus drink. I keep indoctrinating people to drink it and it's so good. I've been trying to make it a “thing” as a chaser for tequila.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What is your go-to meal to cook for someone if you're trying to impress them?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">When I was in New York, I actually got invited to a Shabbat dinner and I cooked my famous ceviche. This is an exclusive for Morning Brew on how I get my ceviche to taste so good. Do you know how there’s that milky water or milky sauce from the fish in ceviche? It’s called Tiger’s Milk. The secret is to drain that after cooking and make a fresh sauce before serving.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What’s in the cards for the future of snacks?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">I want to see more <a href="https://liquiddeath.com/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Liquid Death</a>-type of stuff. I'm done with the pastels and “blanding.” Give me some chaos.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What are you obsessed with outside of the snack world?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">I’m obsessed with learning about how Web3 [an internet built on <a href="https://decrypt.co/resources/what-is-web-3?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">decentralized networks</a>] is evolving. It feels like a renaissance. I'm a ’90s kid and Web3 makes me feel very nostalgic for when I was growing up with the internet, like the AOL time.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What about Web3 is so exciting to you?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Web 1.0 was all “let's have fun with the internet.” I remember what it was like surfing the web and spending hours and hours learning random stuff. And it was chaotic, I loved it.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">In the past decade, with Facebook and other Big Tech companies, everybody just wanted to look like each other. And the internet became boring. The internet should be fun. It should be chaotic.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>What internet groups were you a part of when you were growing up?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Neopets, Club Penguin, and I was obsessed with this <em>Lizzie McGuire</em> site. I remember using my 15 minutes on the internet to go on the <em>Lizzie McGuire</em> page.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>If you had a year of your life to dedicate to research and write someone's biography, who would your subject be?</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Jorge Luis Borges, a Latin American author who wrote the weirdest, most mind-bending magical realism stories. Also, Jeff Goldblum.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><em>This interview has been edited and condensed for clarity.</em></p>
</div>

<tr>
<td align="left" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 10px 0px; word-break: break-word;">

“We’re Back, Baby” — Jeans

<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Shorts, t-shirts, and hard seltzers had a good summer run, but now that the leaves are turning, there’s a new seamed sheriff in town: Jeans. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Along with stout beers, hot coffee, and football, <a href="https://mugsyjeans.com/collections/top-sellers?utm_source=mornginbrew&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=morningbrew101021&utm_id=Morning+Brew+10.10.21" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Mugsy Jeans</a> are a classic fall staple. These denim wonders are made with a proprietary stretch material, so they work great at the office, at the gym, or on date night. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><a href="https://mugsyjeans.com/collections/top-sellers?utm_source=mornginbrew&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=morningbrew101021&utm_id=Morning+Brew+10.10.21" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Mugsy</a> tested their jeans while cruising on jet skis, playing basketball, lifting weights, and racing vehicles. No, Mugsy’s neighbors aren’t thrilled with them, but the pants passed with flying colors. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Bottom line: These jeans are made for guys who like to have fun in life and aren’t afraid to go in for seconds. They offer the perfect amount of stretch and flexibility right where you need them <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/winking-face_1f609.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt="">. </p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><a href="https://mugsyjeans.com/collections/top-sellers?utm_source=mornginbrew&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=morningbrew101021&utm_id=Morning+Brew+10.10.21" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Get $10 off your first Mugsy Jeans purchase with code Brew10</a>. </p>

<tr class="">
<td class="column" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
Taking Back Sunday
</h1>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/08/make-it-work-taking-back-sunday?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" style="text-decoration:none; border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Make it work image " style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/7b6de1bb891bb0dd9e289abb0a591582a5da30e6-1503x603.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;">
<small>
<em></em>
</small>
</p>
</a>
<div>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><em>Each week, our workplace whisperer Shane Loughnane answers a reader-submitted question about work in 2021. Anything bothering you at work? <a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/24880110.2715963/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77Bb6753cbd?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ask Shane here</a>.</em></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Last week, a reader from Singapore asked about dealing with the “Sunday Scaries,” proof that Monday can be found hiding under our beds in any hemisphere. I asked our readers to weigh in and, as usual, you delivered. For example, I learned that Rachel debriefs with her neighbors over “wine and waffles” on Sunday evenings, which sounds as delicious as it does therapeutic. I’ve also been turned on to the <a href="https://open.spotify.com/show/0C3OMp75h8fS9yxB5lueoZ?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Sunday Scaries</em> by Headspace</a> podcast, recommended by Colleen and others.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">In honor of all the great responses, I thought we might take this opportunity to highlight some of the other notable replies that Make It Work has received recently:</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>You Light Up My (Zoom) Life</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">A few weeks ago, we met Brandon, who was trying to look his best on Zoom in the absence of natural light. While the ring light advice shined brightest, I was also reminded that within Zoom settings, you’re able to <a href="https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115002595343-Improving-poor-video-quality?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb#h_01EEEKW0BFQT6E0CCMQ08J5HVV" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">touch up your appearance, adjust for bad lighting, and more</a> (h/t Angie and others). For those of you still looking to become “Lord of the Ring light,” here were a few specific recs that came through:</p>
<ul style="line-height:22px">
<li>
<span><a href="https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07GGNK93T?ref=ppx_pop_mob_ap_share" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Selfie Ring Light</a></span><span> (tripod not included)—Hannah</span>
</li>
<li>
<span><a href="https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08LZKSMRH/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o03_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1&pldnSite=1" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Lighting Kit</a></span><span>—Emily and Connie</span>
</li>
<li>
<span>This great video on </span><span><a href="https://youtu.be/jiUpK0dhWTE?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lighting hacks</a></span><span>, courtesy of Andrew and Keith</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Writing on the Wall</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Finally, we had Rachel, who was in search of a quote for her office wall. Ted Lasso’s infinite wisdom may have won the day, but we also learned that Stuart gets his motivation via the <a href="https://thewire.fandom.com/wiki/Epigraphs?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">openings on<em> The Wire</em></a>, while Sophie reminded us that we need not look any further than a <a href="https://www.tumblr.com/tagged/halls+cough+drops?sort=top" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Halls</em> cough drop wrapper</a> for encouragement. Don’t have HBO Max or the common cold? These readers have got you covered:</p>
<ul style="line-height:22px">
<li><span>“A year from now, don’t wish you had started today.”—Bob</span></li>
<li><span>“None of us are as smart as all of us.”—Jai and Terry</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">I like to think this column is a testament to that last quote. Indeed the collective knowledge of our readers is our greatest asset—as long as you keep submitting your questions and responses, I promise to do my best to help “make it work” here every Sunday (scaries or shine).</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><em>Have a question about work you want to ask Shane? <a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/24880110.2715963/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77Cb6753cbd?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Write in here</a>. And if these work topics are super interesting to you then be sure to check out our newly launched <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/hr/subscribe?utm_campaign=hr_in_morningbrew_sundays&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=crosspromo" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">HR Brew newsletter</a>.</em></p>
</div>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;color: #353535; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px; line-height: 22px; table-layout: auto; width: 100%; border: none;" width="100%">
<tr>
<td width="33%" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt">
<div style="text-align: center; background: linear-gradient(90deg, #ffe62e 25%, #0f9046); background-color: #1c7ff2; line-height: 4px; font-size: 4px; width: 100%; margin: 20px 0;">

</td>
<td style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border: 2px solid #353535; background: white; margin: 0px; padding: 10px;">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;word-break: keep-all; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center; text-transform: uppercase; font-family: Georgia, 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-weight: 700; font-size: 16px; line-height: 18px; color: #353535; padding: 0px; margin: 0px;">
ANALYSIS
</p>
</td>
<td width="33%" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt">
<div style="text-align: center; background: linear-gradient(90deg, #2b9295, #1c7ff2); background-color: #1c7ff2; line-height: 4px; font-size: 4px; width: 100%; margin: 20px 0;">
 
</div>

</td>

<tr class="">
<td class="column" style="border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;">
<div style="font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;">
<h1 style="margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left">
The Tax Badlands
</h1>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/08/how-south-dakota-became-one-of-the-biggest-tax-havens-in-the-world?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" style="text-decoration:none; border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Mt. Rushmore " style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/5f0f0a574e57bd6668e4214d6d947a4002ca8b75-1024x667.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;">
<small>
<em>Scott Olson/Getty Images</em>
</small>
</p>
</a>
<div>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">One of the world’s most prolific offshore tax havens is located more than 1,000 miles from any shore.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">The US state of South Dakota <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/news/2021/oct/04/pandora-papers-reveal-south-dakotas-role-as-367bn-tax-haven?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">now rivals</a> notorious tax shelters like Panama, the Cayman Islands, and Switzerland as a destination for the top 0.01% to shield their  wealth from the grubby hands of tax authorities, the newly released Pandora Papers show.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>Quick recap: </strong>The Pandora Papers, published one week ago, represent one of the biggest leaks of financial docs in history. They show how celebrities, world leaders, and business magnates take advantage of opaque financial laws to hold onto as much of their wealth as they can...and, in some cases, get away with crimes.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">And while none of that is particularly surprising, what <em>is </em>surprising is the changing geography of tax havens. The ultrarich are taking their money out of traditional tax shelters like the island of Jersey (one of the Channel Islands) and stashing it in rural US states like Nevada, Wyoming, and, most of all...South Dakota.</p>
<ul style="line-height:22px"><li><span>Of the more than 200 US trusts appearing in the Pandora Papers, 81 were located in South Dakota.</span></li></ul>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">South Dakota’s trust industry held $367 billion in anonymous, untraceable assets in 2020, a nearly 4x increase from $75.5 billion in 2011. And these trusts aren’t catering to cattle ranchers who made it big—they’re linked to individuals in 40 different countries outside the US.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">The bigger issue? 28 US-based trusts are linked to individuals or companies accused of misconduct overseas, such as money laundering, bribery, and human rights abuses, per the Washington Post.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px"><strong>And now the question you’ve all been waiting for…</strong></p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Why South Dakota?</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">It’s not why most people arrive in South Dakota—by accident. For decades, the state has intentionally <a href="https://www.axios.com/south-dakota-global-tax-haven-5120d206-20ab-4cc1-ba91-d1d59fe22487.html?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">loosened regulations</a> on its financial services sector to grow its economy and create finance jobs, particularly in the city of Sioux Falls.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">This deregulation push, spurred by trust industry insiders, turned a South Dakotan trust into “the most potent force-field money can buy,” <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/nov/14/the-great-american-tax-haven-why-the-super-rich-love-south-dakota-trust-laws?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wrote</a> the Guardian's Oliver Bullough.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">By setting up a trust in South Dakota…</p>
<ul style="line-height:22px">
<li><span>Your assets are protected from claims by creditors, angry clients, or even your ex-spouse (a level of security not afforded by other tax havens).</span></li>
<li><span>You are not subject to income tax, inheritance tax, or capital gains tax in the state...because South Dakota has none of those.</span></li>
<li><span>You never actually have to go to South Dakota.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">In sum, if you’re a shady billionaire or a corrupt president of a Latin American country with something to hide, South Dakota looks like a mighty attractive place to shield your fortune from governments.</p>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Or, rather, the US more broadly is an attractive place to hide your wealth. After years of bashing “offshore” havens for sheltering tax avoiders, the US has moved up to second in the world rankings for financial secrecy. —<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

</h1>
<div>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Welcome to Open House, the only newsletter section that’s now using the tagline, “That’s really it.” We’ll give you a few facts about a listing and you try to guess the price.</p>
<img class="img-responsive" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/66263efd46df35e3588dff06e6d333d85ffd6c72-1019x578.gif?w=670&q=70&auto=format" alt="Tiny house in Newton, Massachusetts" style="border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;width:100% !important"><p><em>Redfin</em></p><p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">Today’s <a href="https://www.redfin.com/MA/Newton/1295-Boylston-St-02464/home/11458145?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=mb" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">listing</a> is...small. It’s a 251-square-foot tiny home in Newton, Massachusetts, a pricey Boston suburb with a downtown area it calls “Newton Centre,” just like the Brits would. This tiny home is the perfect place for anyone who wants the feel of an NYC apartment but none of the access to a $1 pizza slice. Amenities include:</p>
<ul style="line-height:22px">
<li><span>1 bed, (maybe) 3/4 bath</span></li>
<li><span>The smallest oven you ever did see</span></li>
<li><span>Mere inches of granite countertops</span></li>
<li>
<span>Living in the same town where Jim and Ryan from </span><span><em>The Office </em></span><span>grew up</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px">How much to pretend you’re a giant?</p>

style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding: 0px 40px 16px 40px; border-left: 2px solid #353535; border-right: 2px solid #353535; border-bottom: 2px solid #353535; border-collapse: collapse; border-radius: 0px 0px 10px 10px;\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv style=\"font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eGood morning. \u003c/strong\u003eToday is World Mental Health Day. Since one of the ways you can practice good mental health is to express gratitude, I’d like to express \u003cem\u003emy \u003c/em\u003egratitude to my friend and Morning Brew cofounder and executive chairman Alex Lieberman for working to destigmatize mental health issues.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eA lot of people look up to Alex. And they should—he started Morning Brew from nothing and was relentless in building the company to the digital media rocket ship it is today.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eWhat’s even more important than that, in my opinion, is how Alex uses his platform to talk about his own struggles with mental health. Alex has said he's had anxiety for his entire life, \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/businessbarista/status/1400140794640674819?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edescribing it\u003c/a\u003e as a “pressure on my chest like a 10lb dumbbell is resting on it.” He’s also explained how he manages his anxiety, including doing therapy and establishing a strict, daily routine.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eWhen someone as successful as Alex—or, for that matter, Simone Biles or Naomi Osaka—open up about their struggles with mental health, it can create a much bigger space for these conversations.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eSo, thank you Alex.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;font-family:flood-std, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;font-size:16px;font-weight:500\"\u003e—Neal Freyman\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE --\u003e\n\u003ctr class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003ctd align=\"left\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;font-size: 0px; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv style=\"font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;\"\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003e\nIcebreakers With...Andrea Hernández\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/08/icebreakers-with-snaxpert-andrea-hernandez?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" style=\"text-decoration:none; border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Andrea Hernández headshot\" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/4d8083b28a2376ac0da6da7caf2e062b96513fe1-1500x927.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\n\u003cem\u003eAndrea Hernández\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eWe all have an opinion on sour cream and onion chips, but media entrepreneur Andrea Hernández is a snack \u003cem\u003eexpert\u003c/em\u003e. And she’s not being stingy with her wisdom. As a member of Andrea’s Snaxshot cult (her words, not ours) you can read her \u003ca href=\"https://snaxshot.substack.com/?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enewsletter\u003c/a\u003e that dives into snack aisle trends, chat about alt-meat brands in her Discord channel, or just \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/iiiitsandrea?s=20\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etag\u003c/a\u003e her in your latest granola bar haul.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eWe sat down for a chaotic chat with Andrea.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat are you obsessed with in the snack world right now?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://ruby.fun/?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eRuby\u003c/a\u003e, the hibiscus drink. I keep indoctrinating people to drink it and it's so good. I've been trying to make it a “thing” as a chaser for tequila.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat is your go-to meal to cook for someone if you're trying to impress them?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eWhen I was in New York, I actually got invited to a Shabbat dinner and I cooked my famous ceviche. This is an exclusive for Morning Brew on how I get my ceviche to taste so good. Do you know how there’s that milky water or milky sauce from the fish in ceviche? It’s called Tiger’s Milk. The secret is to drain that after cooking and make a fresh sauce before serving.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat’s in the cards for the future of snacks?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eI want to see more \u003ca href=\"https://liquiddeath.com/?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eLiquid Death\u003c/a\u003e-type of stuff. I'm done with the pastels and “blanding.” Give me some chaos.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat are you obsessed with outside of the snack world?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eI’m obsessed with learning about how Web3 [an internet built on \u003ca href=\"https://decrypt.co/resources/what-is-web-3?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edecentralized networks\u003c/a\u003e] is evolving. It feels like a renaissance. I'm a ’90s kid and Web3 makes me feel very nostalgic for when I was growing up with the internet, like the AOL time.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat about Web3 is so exciting to you?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eWeb 1.0 was all “let's have fun with the internet.” I remember what it was like surfing the web and spending hours and hours learning random stuff. And it was chaotic, I loved it.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIn the past decade, with Facebook and other Big Tech companies, everybody just wanted to look like each other. And the internet became boring. The internet should be fun. It should be chaotic.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhat internet groups were you a part of when you were growing up?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eNeopets, Club Penguin, and I was obsessed with this \u003cem\u003eLizzie McGuire\u003c/em\u003e site. I remember using my 15 minutes on the internet to go on the \u003cem\u003eLizzie McGuire\u003c/em\u003e page.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eIf you had a year of your life to dedicate to research and write someone's biography, who would your subject be?\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eJorge Luis Borges, a Latin American author who wrote the weirdest, most mind-bending magical realism stories. Also, Jeff Goldblum.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eThis interview has been edited and condensed for clarity.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse\" width=\"100%\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px\"\u003e\n\u003ca rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/08/icebreakers-with-snaxpert-andrea-hernandez\u0026utm_source=facebook_share\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block; padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv style=\"font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;\"\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003e\nTaking Back Sunday \n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/08/make-it-work-taking-back-sunday?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" style=\"text-decoration:none; border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Make it work image \" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/7b6de1bb891bb0dd9e289abb0a591582a5da30e6-1503x603.png?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\n\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eEach week, our workplace whisperer Shane Loughnane answers a reader-submitted question about work in 2021. Anything bothering you at work? \u003ca href=\"https://link.morningbrew.com/click/24880110.2715963/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77Bb6753cbd?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eAsk Shane here\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eLast week, a reader from Singapore asked about dealing with the “Sunday Scaries,” proof that Monday can be found hiding under our beds in any hemisphere. I asked our readers to weigh in and, as usual, you delivered. For example, I learned that Rachel debriefs with her neighbors over “wine and waffles” on Sunday evenings, which sounds as delicious as it does therapeutic. I’ve also been turned on to the \u003ca href=\"https://open.spotify.com/show/0C3OMp75h8fS9yxB5lueoZ?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eSunday Scaries\u003c/em\u003e by Headspace\u003c/a\u003e podcast, recommended by Colleen and others.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIn honor of all the great responses, I thought we might take this opportunity to highlight some of the other notable replies that Make It Work has received recently:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eYou Light Up My (Zoom) Life\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eA few weeks ago, we met Brandon, who was trying to look his best on Zoom in the absence of natural light. While the ring light advice shined brightest, I was also reminded that within Zoom settings, you’re able to \u003ca href=\"https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115002595343-Improving-poor-video-quality?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb#h_01EEEKW0BFQT6E0CCMQ08J5HVV\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etouch up your appearance, adjust for bad lighting, and more\u003c/a\u003e (h/t Angie and others). For those of you still looking to become “Lord of the Ring light,” here were a few specific recs that came through:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"line-height:22px\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07GGNK93T?ref=ppx_pop_mob_ap_share\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eSelfie Ring Light\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e (tripod not included)—Hannah\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08LZKSMRH/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o03_s00?ie=UTF8\u0026psc=1\u0026pldnSite=1\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eLighting Kit\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e—Emily and Connie\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThis great video on \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://youtu.be/jiUpK0dhWTE?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elighting hacks\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, courtesy of Andrew and Keith\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWriting on the Wall\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eFinally, we had Rachel, who was in search of a quote for her office wall. Ted Lasso’s infinite wisdom may have won the day, but we also learned that Stuart gets his motivation via the \u003ca href=\"https://thewire.fandom.com/wiki/Epigraphs?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eopenings on\u003cem\u003e The Wire\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e, while Sophie reminded us that we need not look any further than a \u003ca href=\"https://www.tumblr.com/tagged/halls+cough+drops?sort=top\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eHalls\u003c/em\u003e cough drop wrapper\u003c/a\u003e for encouragement. Don’t have HBO Max or the common cold? These readers have got you covered:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"line-height:22px\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“A year from now, don’t wish you had started today.”—Bob\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“None of us are as smart as all of us.”—Jai and Terry\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eI like to think this column is a testament to that last quote. Indeed the collective knowledge of our readers is our greatest asset—as long as you keep submitting your questions and responses, I promise to do my best to help “make it work” here every Sunday (scaries or shine).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eHave a question about work you want to ask Shane? \u003ca href=\"https://link.morningbrew.com/click/24880110.2715963/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9mWTFDR3p5WT91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77Cb6753cbd?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eWrite in here\u003c/a\u003e. padding: 25px; word-break: break-word;\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv style=\"font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 16px; text-align: left; color: #353535;\"\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"margin-top:0px;font-family:Georgia;font-size:24px;font-style:normal;font-weight:700;line-height:34px;letter-spacing:0em;text-align:left\"\u003e\nThe Tax Badlands\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/08/how-south-dakota-became-one-of-the-biggest-tax-havens-in-the-world?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" style=\"text-decoration:none; border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Mt. Rushmore \" style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/5f0f0a574e57bd6668e4214d6d947a4002ca8b75-1024x667.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:16px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\n\u003cem\u003eScott Olson/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\n\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eOne of the world’s most prolific offshore tax havens is located more than 1,000 miles from any shore.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eThe US state of South Dakota \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/news/2021/oct/04/pandora-papers-reveal-south-dakotas-role-as-367bn-tax-haven?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enow rivals\u003c/a\u003e notorious tax shelters like Panama, the Cayman Islands, and Switzerland as a destination for the top 0.01% to shield their  wealth from the grubby hands of tax authorities, the newly released Pandora Papers show.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eQuick recap: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Pandora Papers, published one week ago, represent one of the biggest leaks of financial docs in history. They show how celebrities, world leaders, and business magnates take advantage of opaque financial laws to hold onto as much of their wealth as they can...and, in some cases, get away with crimes.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eAnd while none of that is particularly surprising, what \u003cem\u003eis \u003c/em\u003esurprising is the changing geography of tax havens. The ultrarich are taking their money out of traditional tax shelters like the island of Jersey (one of the Channel Islands) and stashing it in rural US states like Nevada, Wyoming, and, most of all...South Dakota.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOf the more than 200 US trusts appearing in the Pandora Papers, 81 were located in South Dakota.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eSouth Dakota’s trust industry held $367 billion in anonymous, untraceable assets in 2020, a nearly 4x increase from $75.5 billion in 2011. And these trusts aren’t catering to cattle ranchers who made it big—they’re linked to individuals in 40 different countries outside the US.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eThe bigger issue? 28 US-based trusts are linked to individuals or companies accused of misconduct overseas, such as money laundering, bribery, and human rights abuses, per the Washington Post.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eAnd now the question you’ve all been waiting for…\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eWhy South Dakota?\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIt’s not why most people arrive in South Dakota—by accident. For decades, the state has intentionally \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/south-dakota-global-tax-haven-5120d206-20ab-4cc1-ba91-d1d59fe22487.html?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eloosened regulations\u003c/a\u003e on its financial services sector to grow its economy and create finance jobs, particularly in the city of Sioux Falls.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eThis deregulation push, spurred by trust industry insiders, turned a South Dakotan trust into “the most potent force-field money can buy,” \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/nov/14/the-great-american-tax-haven-why-the-super-rich-love-south-dakota-trust-laws?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=mb\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrote\u003c/a\u003e the Guardian's Oliver Bullough.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eBy setting up a trust in South Dakota…\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"line-height:22px\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYour assets are protected from claims by creditors, angry clients, or even your ex-spouse (a level of security not afforded by other tax havens).\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYou are not subject to income tax, inheritance tax, or capital gains tax in the state...because South Dakota has none of those.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYou never actually have to go to South Dakota.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eIn sum, if you’re a shady billionaire or a corrupt president of a Latin American country with something to hide, South Dakota looks like a mighty attractive place to shield your fortune from governments.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"display:block;margin:13px 0;line-height:22px\"\u003eOr, rather, the US more broadly is an attractive place to hide your wealth. After years of bashing “offshore” havens for sheltering tax avoiders, the US has moved up to second in the world rankings for financial secrecy. —\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;border-collapse: collapse\" width=\"100%\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-lspace:0pt;mso-table-rspace:0pt;padding-top: 12px\"\u003e\n\u003ca rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/08/how-south-dakota-became-one-of-the-biggest-tax-havens-in-the-world\u0026utm_source=facebook_share\" class=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg style=\"border:0;height:auto;line-height:100%;outline:none;text-decoration:none;-ms-interpolation-mode:bicubic;display: inline-block;
